titlePart.text: MACHINES, DEVICES OR PROCESSES FOR GRINDING OR POLISHING
titlePart.entryReference: grinding of gear teeth , of screw thread
tools for grinding, buffing or sharpening
grinding arrangements for use on assembled railway tracks

titlePart.text: Methods for grinding or working essentially requiring the use of grinding, polishing, or finishing machines or devices
Use of auxiliary equipment in connection with such methods
for cutting pieces from stock, i.e. severing
for working materials by subjecting abrading substances or abrading tools to a bouncing action of ultrasonic frequency
Sharpening cutting edges, e.g. of tools
Accessories therefor, e.g. for holding the tools
titlePart.entryReference: non-abrasive sharpening devices for scythes, sickles, or the like
sharpening devices designed as components of machines with cutters, see the relevant classes for the machines, e.g. ,

titlePart.text: of face or end milling cutters or cutter heads, e.g. of shank type
of profile milling cutters, e.g. of disc type
Tapering or chamfering taps or reamers
Relief cutting of taps or reamers
of the point of twist drills
by swivelling the drill around an axis angularly to the drill axis
and rotating the drill about its own axis
of turning or planing tools or tool bits, e.g. gear cutters
for planing wood, e.g. cutter blades
Processes or apparatus specially adapted for sharpening curved edges
helically bent, e.g. for lawn mowers

titlePart.entryReference: by an abrasive block without mechanisms

titlePart.text: of knife bars for harvesting machines
of tools not covered by the preceding sub-groups
Machines or devices designed for grinding surfaces of revolution on work

titlePart.entryReference: honing machines or devices using abrading blocks performing axial and rotary movements superimposed on one another

titlePart.text: involving centres or chucks for holding work

titlePart.entryReference: grinding combined cylindrical and conical surfaces

titlePart.text: for grinding cylindrical surfaces both externally and internally with several grinding wheels
for grinding conical surfaces, e.g. of centres
for grinding peculiarly profiled surfaces, e.g. bulged
involving centreless means for supporting, guiding, floating or rotating work
for grinding cylindrical surfaces, e.g. on bolts
for grinding peculiarly profiled surfaces, e.g. bulged
for grinding outer surfaces concentrically to bores, involving additional centring means
involving work-supporting means carrying several work-pieces to be operated on in succession
for externally grinding travelling elongated stock, e.g. wire
for grinding rims of vehicle wheels, e.g. for bicycles
for grinding walls of very fine holes, e.g. in drawing-dies
characterised by a special design with respect to properties of the material of non-metallic articles to be ground, e.g. strings
titlePart.entryReference: grinding profiles in treads of tyres

titlePart.text: Machines or devices designed for grinding plane surfaces on work
involving a reciprocatingly-moved work-table or grinding wheel
involving a sequence of travelling work-tables
involving a stationary work-table with an abrasive wheel built in

titlePart.entryReference: grinding tools or machines specially designed for use on assembled railway track

titlePart.text: for grinding travelling elongated stock, e.g. sheets
for grinding slideways, e.g. of machine tools
for grinding end faces, e.g. of gap gauges, gauge blocks, rollers, nuts, piston rings, coils
for grinding floorings, e.g. terrazzo, parquet
titlePart.entryReference: machines or devices for cleaning floorings ,

titlePart.text: characterised by a special design with respect to properties of the material of non-metallic articles to be ground
for grinding stone, ceramic, crystals, or vitrified substances, e.g. tiles
for grinding or polishing glass, e.g. plate-glass
on opposite faces on continuously-travelling bands of glass
Machines or devices designed for grinding edges of or bevels on work

titlePart.entryReference: for sharpening cutting edges on tools

titlePart.text: characterised by a special design with respect to properties of materials specific to articles to be ground
of stone, ceramics, or vitrified substances
Machines or devices designed for grinding spherical surfaces or parts of spherical surfaces on work

titlePart.entryReference: specially designed for optical surfaces , for seat surfaces

titlePart.text: acting by the front faces, e.g. of plane, grooved, or bevelled shape
Machines or devices designed for grinding optical surfaces on lenses or surfaces of similar shape on other work
by means of tools with abrading surfaces corresponding in shape with the lenses or other work to be made
involving grinding wheels controlled by a gearing
Machines or devices designed for grinding seat surfaces
for grinding co-operating seat surfaces by moving one over the other
Machines or devices for grinding controlled by patterns, magnetic tapes, or equivalent means, e.g. by copying devices

noteParagraph.text: This group is restricted to special adaptions of machines or devices controlled by patterns, etc., to grinding, the machines or devices being classified in the sub-groups according to kind of control apparatus used.

titlePart.text: involving electrical transmission means only, e.g. controlled by magnetic tape
Single purpose machines or devices for particular grinding operations not covered by any preceding main group
titlePart.entryReference: tapering, chamfering or relief cutting of taps or reamers ,

titlePart.text: for grinding grooves, e.g. on shafts, in casings, in tubes, in gun barrels
for grinding races, e.g. roller races
for grinding non-circular workpieces, e.g. shafts of elliptical cross-section
for grinding rings, e.g. piston rings
for grinding impellers or impeller wheels of non-positive displacement machines, e.g. turbine blades
for grinding sharp-pointed workpieces, e.g. needles, injection needles
for grinding carding equipment, e.g. card-clothings
titlePart.entryReference: devices for sharpening card-clothings built in or attachable to carding machines
for grinding walls of very fine holes

titlePart.text: characterised by a special design with respect to properties of the material of non-metallic articles to be ground
Machines or devices using abrasive belts or cords, e.g. for sanding wood

titlePart.entryReference: for sharpening cutting edges of tools

titlePart.text: designed for grinding surfaces of revolution on work
involving members with limited contact area pressing the belt against the work, e.g. shoes sweeping across the whole area to be ground
involving a rigid member, e.g. pressure bar, table, pressing or supporting the belt over substantially its whole span
involving a contact wheel or roller pressing the belt against the work
designed for grinding other surfaces of particular shape
Accessories, e.g. for controlling the tracking of the grinding belts
Accessories for use with hand grinding tools
titlePart.entryReference: arrangements for supporting or guiding portable metal-working machines or apparatus, in general

titlePart.text: Arrangements for securing portable grinding machines or devices or workpieces or other parts of particular section, e.g. for grinding commutators
Grinding machines or devices in which the grinding tool is supported on a swinging arm

titlePart.entryReference: machines or devices for grinding or polishing plate-glass

noteParagraph.text: The groups under this heading are restricted to features peculiar to the specified arts; other features are classified in the preceding groups for grinding machines or devices.

titlePart.text: Machines or devices designed for polishing surfaces on work by means of buffing tools, i.e. of soft and flexible material without abrasive properties
Machines or devices designed for polishing or abrading surfaces on work by means of tumbling apparatus or other apparatus in which the work or the abrasive material is loose
involving a rotating bowl in which a ring zone of abrasive powder is formed by centrifugal forces
involving other means for mutual tumbling of work
Abrading-bodies specially designed for tumbling apparatus, e.g. abrading-balls
Honing machines or devices using abrading blocks performing axial and rotary movements superimposed on one another
designed for working internal surfaces of revolution, e.g. of cylindrical or conical shapes
designed for working external surfaces of revolution
designed for working grooves, e.g. in gun barrels
Honing tools for such machines or devices
Machines or devices designed for superfinishing surfaces on work, i.e. by means of abrading blocks reciprocating with high frequency
Lapping machines or devices, i.e. requiring pulverulent abrading substances inserted between a lap of relatively soft but rigid material and the surface to be lapped
designed for working surfaces of revolution
designed for working grooves, e.g. in gun barrels
Burnishing machines or devices, i.e. requiring pressure members for compacting the surface zone
titlePart.entryReference: modifying the physical properties or structure of metal by burnishing ,

titlePart.text: designed for working internal surfaces of revolution
designed for working external surfaces of revolution
Component parts of grinding machines or devices so far as specially adapted to grinding
titlePart.entryReference: if peculiar to a particular type of machine or device, see the relevant group therefor
if applicable to other machine tools, takes precedence

titlePart.text: Component parts such as frames, beds, carriages, headstocks
Means for securing grinding wheels on rotary arbors
titlePart.entryReference: testing static or dynamic balancing of machines

titlePart.text: for performing a reciprocating movement of carriages or work-tables
by liquid or gas pressure only
by mechanical gearing combined with fluid systems
for rotating or reciprocating working-spindles carrying grinding wheels or workpieces
by mechanical gearing or electric power
performing a reciprocating movement, e.g. during which the sense of rotation of the working-spindle is reversed
for rotating the spindle at a speed adaptable to wear of the grinding wheel
Equipment for exact control of the position of the grinding tool or work at the start of the grinding operation
involving adjusting the position of dressing tools
Measuring or gauging equipment for controlling the feed movement of the grinding tool or work
Arrangements of indicating or measuring equipment, e.g. for indicating the start of the grinding operation
titlePart.entryReference: if applicable to other machine tools , take precedence

titlePart.text: according to the instantaneous size and required size of the workpiece acted upon, the measuring or gauging being continuous or intermittent
according to the final size of the previously-ground workpiece
requiring comparison of the workpiece with standard gauging plugs, rings or the like
taking regard of the temperature during grinding
taking regard of the presence of dressing tools
Arrangements for automatic control of a series of individual steps in grinding a workpiece
titlePart.entryReference: if applicable to other machine tools takes precedence

titlePart.text: Devices or means for truing or conditioning abrading surfaces
of plane surfaces on abrasive tools
of cylindrical or conical surfaces on abrasive tools or wheels
controlled by a pattern or a lever mechanism or gearing
of travelling flexible backings coated with abrasives
Dressing tools equipped with rotary cutters
Safety devices specially combined with or arranged in or specially designed for use in connection with grinding and polishing machines
Accessories fitted to grinding and polishing machines for keeping tools or parts of the machine in good working condition
titlePart.entryReference: of general applicability for machine tools

titlePart.text: Equipment for cooling the grinding surfaces
Protective covers for the grinding wheel
Devices for feeding or applying grinding, polishing or lapping agents
